comment_data.body:
I'm experiencing a problem that may be related, so maybe the following information will help debug this.

Edit: My issue is probably more related to #32379

## Minimal config
```lua
-- Run this file as `nvim --clean -u minimal.lua`

for name, url in pairs {
  ['nvim-lspconfig'] = 'https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig',
  ['gitsigns'] = 'https://github.com/lewis6991/gitsigns.nvim',
} do
  local install_path = vim.fn.fnamemodify('nvim_issue/' .. name, ':p')
  if vim.fn.isdirectory(install_path) == 0 then
    vim.fn.system { 'git', 'clone', '--depth=1', url, install_path }
  end
  vim.opt.runtimepath:append(install_path)
end

require('gitsigns').setup{}

-- Configure pylsp to enable the vim.lsp.buf.format function
require('lspconfig').pylsp.setup{
  cmd = {"/path/to/pylsp"}, -- replace with the actual path to `pylsp`
}

vim.o.signcolumn = 'auto:2'
```

## Reproduction steps
1. In a git repository, I have a tracked python file with the following content:
```python
some_very_very_very_long_variable_name = 10
if some_very_very_very_long_variable_name is not None and some_very_very_very_long_variable_name > 5 - (10 - 6):
    pass
```

2. I change some part of the file (e.g., `10` -> `11`), this causes `gitsigns` to show a sign for the modified line
3. I run `:lua vim.lsp.buf.format()` so the file is reformatted to:
```python
some_very_very_very_long_variable_name = 11
if (
    some_very_very_very_long_variable_name is not None
    and some_very_very_very_long_variable_name > 5 - (10 - 6)
):
    pass
```
4. When I then press `u` to undo the change, and then press `<c-r>` to redo the change, Neovim shows the following text and crashes:
```
nvim: /usr/src/debug/neovim/neovim/src/nvim/decoration.c:1066: buf_signalcols_count_range: Assertion `buf->b_signcols.count[prevwidth - 1] >= 0' failed.
```

## Nvim version
This is the output of `:verbose version`:
```
NVIM v0.11.0
Build type: RelWithDebInfo
LuaJIT 2.1.1741730670
```

## Operating system
Manjaro Linux 25.0.0

## Terminal name/version
foot version: 1.21.0 +pgo +ime +graphemes -assertions

## $TERM
tmux-256color

## Installation
`pacman -Syu nvim`
I was able to reproduce when I noticed the linked neogit issue. Hopefully #33410 resolves this.
